file_content.text: Black Codex access detected. Scanning.
Identity confirmed. Star Cabal databanks intact.
You could make a fortune off this thing. But that'd be a waste....
A thousand years of data looks very small.
All those secrets in one little box. A little underwhelming.
The greatest secrets of the greatest conspiracy ever known are in our hands. How marvelous.
The technology has been upgraded, but the core is nine hundred fifty-seven years old.
Jedi... beware!
Didn't mean to cause you trouble, but the Sith arrived same time as me. Guess we both wanted to see you.
Ardun Kothe. Aren't you supposed to be on Corellia?
What are you doing here?
If you'd arrived a little sooner, I could've used you.
You're late to the party.
Did my best.
You told quite a tale about the Star Cabal, had to see it myself. Managed to follow your ship.
Stay where you are, and don't try anything.
Don't come any closer.
I came alone. Took every trick I knew, but I managed to follow your ship. Then this station appeared, so....
I want to help. That the database you got there?
That's why you came--you want the Black Codex.
You're after their secrets.
I told you, I want to help.
The conspirators' Black Codex, apparently intact.
That's correct.
Hell of a thing.
Sorry. What database?
Heh. I told you, I don't want trouble. But here's what I think.
You can't take this conspiracy apart, find everyone involved without knowing what they know. But you turn those secrets over to your bosses, Empire'll blackmail half the galaxy.
Give it to me, Legate. The SIS will deal with the Star Cabal. And I'll keep their data out of the wrong hands.
The data stays with me. Is that a problem?
I don't think so.
...No. Not a problem.
How do I know you wouldn't abuse the information?
Can I trust you?
You don't. But I'm not the same man who wanted the Shadow Arsenal--when the Star Cabal is gone, their secrets go under lock and key.
You've lied to me too often. The codex stays with me.
I just don't believe you.
Then I trust you'll do what's right.
It's yours. Don't make me regret it.
Here--take the Black Codex.
I swear to you, I'll do right by this.
There's an easier solution than all that.
Sorry. [Destroy the codex]
The Star Cabal is gone. As for keeping their secrets out of the wrong hands....
No. [Destroy the codex]
The enemy is defeated.
Honored Hand of Jadus. Our lord sent us to aid you, but we were detained. Our humble apologies.
Apology accepted. It's my privilege to share the company of Sith.
I'm honored by your presence.
"Our lord" is taking an interest, is he?
You serve Darth Jadus?
Darth Jadus is aware of all things.
Honored agent. The Dark Council learned of your predicament and sent us to join you. We regret that we were detained.
Detained or not, it's my privilege to meet the council's emissaries.
I'm honored by your presence.
Speak of our task.
The Dark Council disbanded my organization. Now they want to help?
What changed their minds?
The balance changes. Knowledge spreads.
Stay where you are. I wasn't told about any Sith.
Don't come any closer.
Local communications are jammed.
We are told that this conspiracy accumulated many secrets. Turn over their data record, and we will deliver it to Lord Jadus so that it may enhance his glory.
We know the Minister of Intelligence is operating without authorization. He will face judgment, but you have served the Empire.
Turn over the data record, and we will deliver it to the Dark Council so that it may enhance our glory.
Suppose I refuse. What then?
What if I say "no"?
You serve the Sith.
Perhaps you've forgotten your place. The value of what you've discovered is for us to determine.
The Black Codex stays with me.
I can't give it to you.
Forgive me, my lord. You're right, of course.
I see. [Give him the codex]
I know its value, and the Black Codex isn't for you--or anyone else.
It's over. [Destroy the codex]
Ha!
We're proud to know you, agent.
Sir, that was--we were ordered....
I'm speechless.
I see.
Well. Huh.
You didn't need me after all. Don't think your side'll like that.
Legate... there's a lot of bad blood between us. But I have to ask--you ever consider joining the Republic?
Are you trying to recruit me?
Why do you ask?
More or less. Be a double agent, for real this time.
You know I just destroyed your prize.
Wait--aren't you angry?
I'm not thrilled about it, but the offer's genuine.
I'd be lying if I said otherwise.
I've thought about it.
Then I'll make you an offer: Be a double agent, for real this time.
Go home, and do what you've been doing; keep the bloodshed down, change the Empire inside-out. Take a lifetime if you have to.
When you finally hear from us, that's when it's time to end the war. It'll take both sides; I'm starting to see that.
I'm sorry, Ardun. I don't share your vision.
I won't serve the Republic.
I asked, you said no. Nothing to apologize for.
And for what it's worth--I'm a better man since I met you. Hope to get better still.
I'll be your double agent.
Kaliyo, why don't you watch the door?
Yeah, like I care about your politics.
Vector, I'd like to talk to him alone.
He could be an ally. But don't forget who you are.
Doctor, this could get delicate. Would you mind leaving us alone?
You want to win his trust. Of course.
Ensign, check the perimeter. I need to handle this alone.
I know you have a history together, sir, but--don't go too far to win his trust.
Check the perimeter. I'll finish up here.
You would hide your intentions from me. How quaint.
If the Empire wins, victory will come at a cost. I believe that cost is too high.
We have a deal, Ardun. When the Republic needs me, send word.
Believe we will. Just be ready to wait.
In the meantime... I could learn from your example.
You two are done making out, we ought to get back to the ship.
Time to return, we think. There are people waiting.
If you're done with the Jedi, I think we should be going.
If you're done, sir, I'm sure our superiors are waiting.
There is nothing left for us here.
One more word about treason and I'll bring your head to the Sith.
Get out before I kill you.
See you around, then, Legate.
Even when I worked for you, I never forgot who I was. You should leave now, Ardun.
My loyalty is to the Empire.
Whatever you end up doing--you're a better person than most. Man like me could learn from that.
Then you die.
The conspirators called it the Black Codex. They wiped the main databank, but I downloaded what I could; use it well.
[Lie] Here it is.
As you wish, my lord.
Take it. [Give him the codex]
You didn't....
Agent?
Sir.
Glory to the Emperor.
You demonstrate weakness.
We must leave.
Thank you, honored Hand. You have done us a great service, and he will know.
The Dark Council will know of your loyalty. This prize... they are intrigued by it.
You didn't, did you?
What was that about?
Sir, what did they just take?
That was not the Black Codex.
You should have killed them.
Tricked by an encrypted holocommunicator. Hope they don't have a slicer.
I gave them my holocommunicator. It's encrypted, but they'll figure it out. We should hurry.
This is why I put up with you.
You lead, we'll follow.
You lied to the Sith.
Agent! I'm surprised at you. And impressed.
Yes.
